definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Secondly, it was after the opening round of the economic operation of infrastructure bottlenecks.
sentences.chinese: 第二，它是后基础设施的瓶颈，经济运行开门红。

sentences.english: Opener Macedonia, the Netherlands 2 to 1 away victory away, get good start.
sentences.chinese: 首战马其顿，荷兰客场2比1客场告捷，取得开门红。

sentences.english: The spectacular gala got the games off to a flying start.
sentences.chinese: 这个壮观的盛会使本届运动会取得开门红。

definition: lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
final part of a go game (see 官子[guan1 zi3])/endgame/to finish up/to come to the final stage
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
to take the lead/to show initiative
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
